main event: In Cho-do, North Korea, on 9th February 1963, military personnel observed five bright lights in a line formation in the sky at an altitude of approximately 1000 ft, which remained constant in brightness and made no maneuvers. The observation lasted for several minutes, and no sound was heard.
interesting points: The observation involved military personnel, adding credibility to the report.
The five bright lights were in a line formation and remained constant in brightness.
No sound was heard and the objects made no maneuvers, suggesting unconventional behavior.
The estimated altitude of the lights was approximately 1000 ft.
The reported sighting lasted for several minutes, allowing for a detailed observation.
sighted object: Five bright lights in a line formation
